thread.title: Bulldogs look for first win at Georgetown
thread.title_full: Bulldogs look for first win at Georgetown

title: Bulldogs look for first win at Georgetown
text:
/ Headlines List / Article 
BARBOURVILLE, Ky. - The Union College football team will play its second road game in as many weeks as they head up Interstate 75 to take on Georgetown (Ky.) on Saturday. 
The game is being played in Georgetown, Ky., and kickoff is set for 1:30 p.m. ET. 
This marks the 41st meeting between the two teams as Georgetown leads the all-time series 31-6-3. 
The Bulldogs (0-5 overall) look to collect their first win on the season, as the last time the Tigers (2-4 overall) entered the matchup with a losing record, Union won 35-28 in 2008. 
Last week, Union was held to under 100 rushing yards for the first time on the season. Georgetown ranks 11th in the NAIA in rushing defense, only allowing 105 yards per game. 
Both teams primarily run the ball as Georgetown has 252 rushing attempts while Union has 208. The Tigers have gained 897 yards on the ground, while finding the end zone eight times. The Bulldogs have gained 834 rushing yards with seven touchdowns. 
The teams have played one common opponent thus far in Lindsey Wilson (Ky.). Georgetown lost Lindsey Wilson 24-17 on Sept. 12, while Union fell to 42-17 on Oct. 3.
